title: node
description: A node in the node hierarchy.  A node can have either camera, meshes, or skeletons/skin/meshes properties defined.

camera.description: The id of the camera referenced by this node.

children.description: The ids of this node's children.

skeletons.gltf_detailedDescription: The id of skeleton nodes.  Each node defines a subtree, which has a jointName of the corresponding element in the referenced skin.joints.

skin.description: The id of the skin referenced by this node.

jointName.description: Name used when this node is a joint in a skin.

matrix.description: A floating-point 4x4 transformation matrix stored in column-major order.
matrix.gltf_detailedDescription: A floating-point 4x4 transformation matrix stored in column-major order.  A node will have either a matrix property defined or any combination of rotation, scale, and translation properties defined.  If none are provided, the transform is the identity.
matrix.gltf_webgl: `uniformMatrix4fv()` with the transpose parameter equal to false

meshes.description: The ids of the meshes in this node.
meshes.gltf_detailedDescription: The ids of the meshes in this node.  Multiple meshes are allowed so each can share the same transform matrix.

rotation.description: The node's unit quaternion rotation in the order (x, y, z, w) where w is the scalar.
rotation.gltf_detailedDescription: The node's unit quaternion rotation in the order (x, y, z, w) where w is the scalar.  A node will have either a matrix property defined or any combination of rotation, scale, and translation properties defined.  If none are provided, the transform is the identity.

scale.gltf_detailedDescription: The node's non-uniform scale.  A node will have either a matrix property defined or any combination of rotation, scale, and translation properties defined.  If none are provided, the transform is the identity.

translation.gltf_detailedDescription: The node's translation.  A node will have either a matrix property defined or any combination of rotation, scale, and translation properties defined.  If none are provided, the transform is the identity.
